### How to Index ObjectId Values in Fields
The `objectId` type can be used to index [ObjectId](https://www.mongodb.com/docs/manual/reference/bson-types/#objectid) field values. Fields of type objectId can be queried using the [equals](https://www.mongodb.com/docs/atlas/atlas-search/equals/#std-label-equals-ref) operator.

The `objectId` type can also be used to index:
- Fields whose value is an array of objectId. To learn more, see [How to Index the Elements of an Array.](https://www.mongodb.com/docs/atlas/atlas-search/field-types/array-type/#std-label-fts-array-ref)
- `objectId` fields inside an array of documents indexed as the [`embeddedDocuments`](https://www.mongodb.com/docs/atlas/atlas-search/field-types/embedded-documents-type/#std-label-bson-data-types-embedded-documents) type.
